description: From Old French estanson, estanchon, (Modern French étançon), from estance (“a stay, a prop”), from Latin stāns (“standing”), present participle of stō.

entries.meaning: A vertical pole, post, or support.
A framework of such posts, used to secure or confine cattle.

verbs.description: stanchion (third-person singular simple present stanchions, present participle stanchioning, simple past and past participle stanchioned)

entries.meaning: To erect stanchions, or equip something with stanchions.
To confine by means of stanchions, typically used for cattle.
